intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius canadense var. macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant Canadian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has rough, hairy leaves and can grow up to 1 meter tall, making it a prominent feature in its native habitats. It thrives in moist, open areas such as meadows and woodland edges. Due to its aggressive growth, it is considered a potential invasive species in some regions.
